variant.question: What does the term "duplex communication" mean?

options.text: One-way communication from aircraft to stations or locations on the surface of the Earth.
One-way communication from stations or locations on the surface of the Earth to aircraft.
Communication between two stations that can take place in both directions simultaneously.
Communication relating to air navigation that is for all aircraft and stations within range.

variant.question: What does the term "simplex communication" mean?

options.text: One-way communication from aircraft to stations or locations on the surface of the Earth.
Any transmission, emission, or reception of signs, signals, writing, images, and sounds.
Communication between two stations which takes place in one direction at a time.
Communication between two stations that can take place in both directions simultaneously.

variant.question: What does the term "Expected Approach Time" mean?

options.text: The holding time over the radio facility from which the instrument approach procedure for a landing will be initiated.
The time at which an arriving aircraft, upon reaching the radio aid serving the destination aerodrome, will commence the instrument approach procedure for a landing.
The time at which an arriving aircraft expects to arrive over the appropriate designated navigation aid serving the destination aerodrome.
The time at which ATC expects that an arriving aircraft, following a delay, will leave the holding point to complete its approach for a landing.
routine information to arriving and departing aircraft by means of continuous and repetitive broadcast.
information concerning en-route weather phenomena which may effect the safety of aircraft operation.
weather reports related to a specific number of aerodromes located within a flight information region (FIR).
current meteorological and operational information essential for the safety of the air navigation within a FIR.

variant.question: Complete the definition of an instrument approach procedure: Instrument approach procedure means a series of predetermined manoeuvres by reference to flight instruments with specified protection from obstacles from the initial approach fix, or where applicable, from the..

options.text: beginning of a defined arrival route to a point from which a landing can be completed.
end of a defined departure route to a point from which a landing can be completed.

beginning of a defined arrival route to a point from which a landing can be completed and thereafter, if a landing is not completed, to a position at which holding or en-route obstacle clearance criteria apply.

end of a defined departure route to a point from which a landing can be completed and thereafter, if a landing is not completed, to a position at which holding or en-route obstacle clearance criteria apply.
A transmission containing meteorological and operational information to aircraft engaged in flights over remote and oceanic areas out of range of VHF ground stations.
A transmission of information relating to air navigation that is not addressed to a specific station or stations.
One-way communication from aircraft to stations or locations on the surface of the earth.
Two-way communication between aircraft and stations or locations on the surface of the earth.
